meanings.definition: A person who lumps things together.
meanings.sent1: The lumper quickly sorted the toys into different boxes.
meanings.sent2: The lumper organized the books by size on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The lumper made a game out of grouping the colored blocks.
meanings.sent4: She was like a lumper, gathering all the scattered papers into neat piles.
meanings.sent5: The lumper's job is to combine similar items into groups.

meanings.definition: A group of workers who load and unload cargo.
meanings.sent1: The lumpers efficiently moved the crates from the truck to the warehouse.
meanings.sent2: The lumpers took a break after unloading the heavy boxes.
meanings.sent3: The lumpers joked around while stacking the bags of rice.
meanings.sent4: The team of lumpers resembled ants carrying food to their nest.
meanings.sent5: The lumpers worked together like a well-oiled machine to handle the shipment.

meanings.definition: A machine used to break up clods of earth.
meanings.sent1: The farmer relied on the lumper to prepare the soil for planting.
meanings.sent2: The lumper efficiently turned over the soil in the field.
meanings.sent3: The lumper hummed as it broke up the hard clumps of dirt.
meanings.sent4: The lumper worked tirelessly, transforming the rough ground into a smooth bed.
meanings.sent5: The lumper's blades sliced through the earth, creating a perfect seedbed.
